SENT.plain: Primary adrenal insufficiency (PAI) is a rare complication of antiphospholipid syndrome (APS)
The hypercoagulable state in the APS may lead to adrenal vein thrombosis and subsequently to hemorrhagic necrosis of the adrenal glands
This complication of APS is important to recognize because it may be fatal if untreated
We describe one case of PAI and primary APS, with magnetic resonance studies consistent with hemorrhagic necrosis of the adrenal glands
